The origin of the claim: The expert identified that the claim originated from a Twitter handle called India With RSS, which claimed to be an independent initiative by Swamyamsevaks. This information helped verify the authenticity of the claim.
Social media shares: The expert mentioned that the image was shared by many people on Twitter and Facebook, along with a message stating that the protest was against fee hike and questioning the presence of RSS placards. This widespread sharing provided additional evidence to support the claim's authenticity.
Reverse image search: The expert conducted a reverse image search on the Russian search engine Yandex and found a Catch News article from 2016. The article described a protest march to the RSS headquarters in Delhi and mentioned the presence of students holding placards with anti-RSS slogans. This corroborated the claim and added further credibility.
Video evidence: The expert referred to a video posted on the Facebook page of Students Federation of India's JNU Unit, showing students holding placards with the same anti-RSS slogan during the protest. This video served as visual evidence supporting the claim's authenticity.
